params._shouldStartAtElement: Index of the element at which this batch should start.

returns._0: Reference to the batch storage container.

params._batchHeader: Header of the batch to start deleting from.
Header of the batch to check.

returns._inside: Whether or not the batch is inside the fraud proof window.

params._batchHeader: Header of the batch in which the element was included.
params._element: Hash of the element to verify a proof for.
params._proof: Merkle inclusion proof for the element.

appendStateBatch(bytes32[],uint256).notice: Appends a batch of state roots to the chain.

deleteStateBatch((uint256,bytes32,uint25.notice: Deletes all state roots after (and including) a given batch.

getLastSequencerTimestamp().notice: Retrieves the timestamp of the last batch submitted by the sequencer.

getTotalBatches().notice: Retrieves the total number of batches submitted.

getTotalElements().notice: Retrieves the total number of elements submitted.

insideFraudProofWindow((uint256,bytes32,.notice: Checks whether a given batch is still inside its fraud proof window.
